intro: Eschscholzia californica var. crocea, commonly known as the California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its vibrant orange to red petals and is part of the Papaveraceae family. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas. It has a taproot system and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. The leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture.
